articles.headline: Drug Prices Keep Rising Despite Intense Criticism
articles.snippet: The burden of drug pricing often falls most heavily on the uninsured, who must pay list price.
articles.abstract: The burden of drug pricing often falls most heavily on the uninsured, who must pay list price.
articles.lead_paragraph: From the campaign trail to the halls of Congress, drug makers have spent much of the last year enduring withering criticism over the rising cost of drugs.

articles.headline: VW Presentation in ’06 Showed How to Foil Emissions Tests
articles.snippet: The proposal, discovered as part of the investigations into Volkswagen, provides a direct link to the genesis of the diesel deception.
articles.abstract: The proposal, discovered as part of the investigations into Volkswagen, provides a direct link to the genesis of the diesel deception.
articles.lead_paragraph: FRANKFURT — A PowerPoint presentation was prepared by a top technology executive at Volkswagen in 2006, laying out in detail how the automaker could cheat on emissions tests in the United States.

articles.headline: IPhone Sales Drop, and Apple’s 13-Year Surge Ebbs
articles.snippet: Revenue fell 13 percent, to $50.6 billion, as sales of the company’s flagship product fell with little else to take its place.
articles.abstract: Revenue fell 13 percent, to $50.6 billion, as sales of the company’s flagship product fell with little else to take its place.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — From the iPod to the iPhone to the iPad, Apple created more than a decade’s worth of new gadgets to fuel its historic growth.

articles.headline: Twitter Narrows Loss, Adds Users and Misses Revenue Forecast
articles.snippet: A small increase in users may not be growth enough for investors, who regularly compare Twitter to Facebook, the social media Goliath.
articles.abstract: A small increase in users may not be growth enough for investors, who regularly compare Twitter to Facebook, the social media Goliath.
articles.lead_paragraph: For all the issues that Twitter has grappled with over the last few years — the slowdown in user growth, a revolving door of executives and confusion over how to use the social media service — it has had one constant pillar of strength: a bulletproof advertising business.

articles.headline: Donald Trump Sweeps 5 States; Hillary Clinton Takes 4
articles.snippet: Mr. Trump won Pennsylvania, Maryland and three other states on Tuesday, decreasing the odds of a contested Republican convention. Mrs. Clinton won Pennsylvania, Connecticut, Maryland and Delaware.
articles.abstract: Mr. Trump won Pennsylvania, Maryland and three other states on Tuesday, decreasing the odds of a contested Republican convention. Mrs. Clinton won Pennsylvania, Connecticut, Maryland and Delaware.
articles.lead_paragraph: Donald J. Trump and Hillary Clinton barreled toward a general election showdown on Tuesday night as they dominated primaries in Pennsylvania, Maryland and other Eastern states, piling up enough delegates to close in on their parties’ nominations.
articles.byline: By Patrick Healy and Jonathan Martin

articles.headline: Pulling Away From Bernie Sanders, Hillary Clinton Is Turning to the Fall
articles.snippet: Stepping up fund-raising for the general election is among the priorities even if the Democratic nomination contest has yet to be settled.
articles.abstract: Stepping up fund-raising for the general election is among the priorities even if the Democratic nomination contest has yet to be settled.
articles.lead_paragraph: PHILADELPHIA — After months of trying to sideline an unexpectedly deft and well-financed liberal opponent, Hillary Clinton on Tuesday won a series of primaries that freed her to present herself as the de facto victor of the Democratic nominating fight and gave her the impetus to shift focus decisively toward the November election.
articles.byline: By Amy Chozick and Alexander Burns

articles.headline: Comcast Is Said to Be in Talks to Acquire DreamWorks Animation
articles.snippet: If a deal goes through, it would value the studio at about $3 billion. Comcast is expected to merge it with its own animation unit, Illumination Entertainment.
articles.abstract: If a deal goes through, it would value the studio at about $3 billion. Comcast is expected to merge it with its own animation unit, Illumination Entertainment.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — After years of on-and-off flirtations, Comcast is in talks to buy DreamWorks Animation, the boutique studio run by Jeffrey Katzenberg that has struggled to move past the boom-and-bust cycle driven by its sporadic film releases.

articles.headline: Dennis Hastert Sentenced to 15 Months, and Apologizes for Sex Abuse
articles.snippet: The former House speaker faced up to five years for his effort to cover up his sexual abuse of high school wrestlers he coached.
articles.abstract: The former House speaker faced up to five years for his effort to cover up his sexual abuse of high school wrestlers he coached.
articles.lead_paragraph: CHICAGO — J. Dennis Hastert, once among the nation’s most powerful politicians, was sentenced on Wednesday to 15 months in prison for illegally structuring bank transactions in an effort to cover up his sexual abuse of young members of a wrestling team he coached decades ago.
articles.byline: By Monica Davey, Julie Bosman and Mitch Smith

articles.headline: A Former Girl Soldier in Colombia Finds ‘Life Is Hard’ as a Civilian
articles.snippet: Charting a future for thousands of young rebel fighters like Mélida is vital to the success of any deal to end 50 years of armed conflict, analysts say.
articles.abstract: Charting a future for thousands of young rebel fighters like Mélida is vital to the success of any deal to end 50 years of armed conflict, analysts say.
articles.lead_paragraph: CALDAS, Colombia — Mélida was only 9 when guerrilla fighters lured her away with the promise of food as she played on the floor. For the next seven years she was held hostage by the rebels, forced to become a child soldier.

articles.headline: Yahoo Agrees to Give 4 Board Seats to Starboard Value
articles.snippet: The activist hedge fund had proposed its own slate of directors if Yahoo did not proceed with a deal to sell its core business.
articles.abstract: The activist hedge fund had proposed its own slate of directors if Yahoo did not proceed with a deal to sell its core business.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — For over a year and a half, Yahoo has been tormented by a prominent activist investor who has criticized virtually everything about the company, from its business strategy to its efforts to sell major assets.
articles.byline: By Michael J. de la Merced and Vindu Goel

articles.headline: Google Shuts Out Competitors on Android? Hardly
articles.snippet: The European Union is arguing that Google’s mobile operating system does not offer enough diversity of product, but consumers swamped in preloaded apps would disagree.
articles.abstract: The European Union is arguing that Google’s mobile operating system does not offer enough diversity of product, but consumers swamped in preloaded apps would disagree.
articles.lead_paragraph: One of the persistent tragedies of Android, Google’s globe-conquering mobile operating system, is that it continues to be better in theory than in reality.

articles.headline: Apple iPhone, Once a Status Symbol in China, Loses Its Luster
articles.snippet: The company’s second-quarter earnings show how hard it can be to keep the attention of the country’s fickle and increasingly hard-to-impress consumers.
articles.abstract: The company’s second-quarter earnings show how hard it can be to keep the attention of the country’s fickle and increasingly hard-to-impress consumers.
articles.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — Since 2010, Yu Kai has followed the ritual every year: When a new Apple iPhone comes out, he gets rid of his old one and heads to a store in Beijing to buy the latest model.
